full_summary:
### Title
Natural Resources Consultant Services (OR24SL01)

### Brief Overview
Defence Construction Canada (DCC) is seeking to establish a Source List (SL) with consulting firms to provide professional services for Department of National Defence (DND) requirements at various locations across Ontario. 

### Solicitation Details
* Solicitation Number: OR24SL01
* Publication Date: May 10, 2024
* Tender Closing Date: June 19, 2024, at 14:00
* Expected Contract Start and End Dates: None specified
* Amendment Number: 3
* Amendment Date: June 19, 2024

### Service Requirements
The selected consulting firms will provide services for various positions, including:

* Source List Manager
* Senior Project Manager
* Senior Scientist or Engineer
* Intermediate Scientist or Engineer
* Senior Technical Staff
* Intermediate Technical Support Staff

### Contract Duration
The Source List is intended to be in effect for three (3) years with a maximum estimated value of $2,000,000.00. The SL may be extended for up to two (2) additional one (1) year periods and increased in the order of $500,000.00 at any time.

### Evaluation Criteria
Information provided by the proponents will be evaluated using the established criteria in the RFAP (Request for Proposal).

### Important Notice
* Questions regarding this solicitation should only be directed to Justin Bennett, the point of contact, at justin.bennett@dcc-cdc.gc.ca or 819-962-2917.
* Bidding and documents are available on http://www.merx.com. Fees may apply; see https://www.merx.com/public/pricing for more information.
* Proponents who address their questions to anyone other than the point of contact during the solicitation period may, for that reason alone, be disqualified.
* Contract award results will be posted on the DCC website at Contract Activity - Defence Construction Canada (cdc-dcc.gc.ca)
### Trade Agreements
This solicitation is being conducted in accordance with the requirements set out in the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Chapter Nineteen of the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), and the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA).
